page.title: 02Keswick in winter and summer
page.content: The town of Keswick attracts many tourists in summer.We get an average of 176,200 visitors going to the Moot Hall to enquire about accommodation in one year.The main attractions are the lakes and mountains.In summer Main Street is a busy place with cars sounding their horns while trying to surge through the crowds.The tourists with packs on their backs make walking on pavements hard.Noise from people and cars is immense.The older folk from Keswick are waiting for peaceful winter again.The population in winter is quite low.We have about 5000 people in the town but we still get some visitors.Derwentwater sometimes freezes over and the locals skate on the ice.Up on the fells the snow is very attractive and deep.The skiers go to Mell Fell when the snow is deep enough.
